Other recent examples that follow the MIT model is the Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE) - which created a degree in Computer Engineering in partnership between the Center for Informatics and the Department of Electronics and Systems - also maintaining the original course of Bachelor in Computer Science from the Federal University of Ouro Preto (UFOP), which will host the course on a campus in João Monlevade, with groups not yet formed and the Federal University of Itajubá (UNIFEI) - that following the same MIT trend, united the electric institutes and computer science to give bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering. A different case was the Federal University of São Carlos (UFSC), who had two modalities of the course of Computer Science: with emphasis on software and one with emphasis on hardware. In this case, it has maintained the original Bachelor Degree courses with an emphasis on software and hardware with an emphasis on course was transformed in the course of Computer Engineering. Currently (2006), a new curriculum was proposed and today the course consists as a computer engineering with an emphasis on control and automation.Which a recent University example that followed the model of MIT?

The Federal University of Rio Grande (UFRJ), located in Rio Grande, Rio Grande do Sul, the Computer Engineering Course was created in 1993 and had its first entry in 1994, and the first class graduated in 1998. In 2008 integrou- to the then newly founded Computer Science Center. In this case, the course, although to base themselves in the general attitudes of education and training in engineering, is not a specialty of Electrical Engineering, but strives for a more targeted computer science's approach to computational solving technical and technological problems , aiming at the autonomous action of the computer engineer or in conjunction with professionals from other fields of engineering and other technological or scientific careers. Today, after extensive structural reform, in addition to having all the traditional basic training for engineering courses (Calculus, Physics, Design, Administration etc.), the curriculum operates under the concept of system with axes ranging from mathematical foundation and own Computer Science (Discrete Mathematics, Data Structures, Databases, programming Languages, Analysis of Algorithms, Software Engineering, Computing Theory etc.), the specific technologies in computing, such as information and programming systems, graphics, intelligent manufacturing, microprocessor and distributed. The "grade" of the course can be found in your page. An approach that the course had to aspects of control and automation and systems analysis concepts was quite diminished from the institution of automation engineering courses and information system at the same University in 2009. Currently the UFRJ account, including, a Master's Degree in Computer Engineering, which in genesis not linked to Electrical Engineering is one of the only in Brazil associated with the Computer Area Committee at CAPES.What is UFRJ?

column2: The course of Computer Federal University of São Francisco Valley Engineering (UNIVASF) was authorized by the 2005 decision of the University Council of UNIVASF. In 2005 it was held the first competition for the recruitment of the first two teachers of the course, which started its activities in 2006. In 2006 there was also the first entrance exam for the field of Computer Engineering. In 2008 the faculty was expanded to 9 members, and then to 14 in 2009. In 2010 the body was completed with the signing of the fifteenth member. The course of Computer Engineering plays an important role in the São Francisco Valley region. Despite the recent developments and investments, the region is still far from reaching the limit of its economic potential. There is a clear possibility of increased production, cost reduction, diversification of production / services and entry into new markets. The Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ), the course of Computer Engineering and Information was created at the Polytechnic School in 2003, which already had the course in Electronics and Computer Engineering (Electronic Engineering with an emphasis on computer), keeping the based electronics and emphasizing the parts of software and information systems.What is UNIVASF?

The course of Computer Federal University of São Francisco Valley Engineering (UNIVASF) was authorized by the 2005 decision of the University Council of UNIVASF. In 2005 it was held the first competition for the recruitment of the first two teachers of the course, which started its activities in 2006. In 2006 there was also the first entrance exam for the field of Computer Engineering. In 2008 the faculty was expanded to 9 members, and then to 14 in 2009. In 2010 the body was completed with the signing of the fifteenth member. The course of Computer Engineering plays an important role in the São Francisco Valley region. Despite the recent developments and investments, the region is still far from reaching the limit of its economic potential. There is a clear possibility of increased production, cost reduction, diversification of production / services and entry into new markets. In industry, where the country is going through a good economic period, there is investment in the production line - including the hiring of skilled personnel to work with sophisticated machines. This bachelor is required to develop software to assist the progress of industries and to create devices such as cell phones, tablets, washing machines and harvesters. column2: Software engineering is an area of ​​dedicated computing the specification, development, maintenance and creation of software, with the application of technologies and project management practices and other disciplines, aimed at organization, productivity and quality. Currently, these technologies and practices include programming languages, database, tools, platforms, libraries, software design patterns, software process and software quality. Moreover, the software engineering should provide mechanisms to plan and manage the development process of a computer system and quality that meets the needs of a requesting software. The scientific basis for software engineering involve the use of abstract and accurate models that allow the engineer to specify, design, implement and maintain software systems, evaluating and ensuring their quality. The area that studies and evaluates the software engineering process, proposing the development of processes, tools and methods to support the software engineering is the Experimental Software Engineering.For what software engineering is facing?
column3: specification, development, maintenance and software creation
column4: the specification, development, maintenance and software creation
column5: Software engineering is an area of ​​dedicated computing the specification, development, maintenance and software creation

Friedrich Ludwig Bauer defined it as: "Software engineering is the creation and use of sound engineering principles in order to obtain economically software that is reliable and works on real machines." Margaret Hamilton is credited for having coined the term "software engineering". The very meaning of engineering already brings the creation of concepts, construction, analysis, development and maintenance. The Software Engineering focuses on the practical aspects of producing a software system as computer science studies the theoretical foundations of computational aspects. The term was coined in the 1960s and used officially in 1968 in the NATO Science Committee. Its creation came about in an attempt to resolve the crisis of the software and give an engineering treatment (more systematic, controlled and measurable quality) to the development of complex software systems. A complex software system is characterized by a set of abstract software components encapsulated in the form of algorithms, functions, modules, objects or agents interconnected with each other, making the software architecture, which should be run on computer systems.What are the concepts brought by the meaning of software engineering?
column3: creation, construction, analysis, development and maintenance
column4: creation, construction, analysis, development and maintenance
column5: creation, construction, analysis, development and maintenance

The scientific foundations of software engineering involve the use of abstract and accurate models that allow the engineer to specify, design, implement and maintain software systems, evaluating and ensuring their quality. In addition, it should provide mechanisms to plan and manage the development process. software development companies began to employ these concepts especially to guide their development areas, many of them organized in the form of Software Factory. Systems engineering is a wide area by dealing with aspects of systems based on computers, including hardware and process engineering for building software. The term methodology is highly controversial in science in general and in particular in Software Engineering. Many authors seem to treat methodology and method interchangeably, but it would be more appropriate to say that a methodology involves philosophical principles that guide a range of methods that use different tools and practices to accomplish something. So we would have, for example, Structured Methodology, in which there are various methods such as analysis and Structured Structured Project (often called SA / SD and Analysis Essential). Thus, both the Structured Analysis as the Essential Analysis using Data Flow Diagram tool to model the operation of the system.What term is controversial in science in general?

Currently there is a very special emphasis on Software Engineering Web. Also used by the acronym Presmann Webe, it is the process used to create WebApps (Web-based applications) High quality. Although the basic principles of Webe are very close to the classic software engineering, there are specific and peculiarities. With the advent of B2B (e-business) and B2C (e-commerce), and even more with applications for Web 2.0, greater importance was being this type of engineering. Usually adopt in developing the architecture MVC (Model-View-Controller).Where there is an emphasis on software engineering?

column2: The theory of computation is a subfield of computer science and mathematics that seeks to determine which problems can be computed for a given computing model. The computation can be defined as the solution of a problem or formally calculating a function by means of an algorithm. Although intuitive in human history, the concept of performing a task with finite steps in order to get a result, that is an algorithm, did not have a formal definition to the concept of the Universal Turing machine model.The theory of computation is a subfield which areas?
column4: The theory of computation is a subfield of computer science and mathematics

The computation theory began in the early twentieth century, before the invention of modern electronic computers. At that time, after the lecture famous German mathematician David Hilbert in which he listed the major challenges in the field of mathematics for the coming century, mathematicians leaned on the tenth Hilbert problem trying to figure out which mathematical problems could be solved by an effective method and which could not. The first step was to define the meaning of "effective method" to solve the problem. In other words, they needed a formal model of computing.Who listed the major challenges in the field of mathematics in the twentieth century?

column2: Several different models of computation have been proposed by the first researchers. One model, known as Turing machine, proposed the construction of a universal machine capable of operating with a sequence of instructions and data intermixed on a tape of infinite length; the machine could operate on a point on the tape at a time using a head for reading and writing, so running the program that you are last. Another model is based on recursive composite functions to operate directly on the numbers. A similar approach is the lambda calculus. Another class of approaches works with grammar rules operating on strings, as in the case of Markov chains and Post systems.What computational model proposed the construction of a universal machine capable of operating with a sequence of instructions?

Another model is based on recursive composite functions to operate directly on the numbers. A similar approach is the lambda calculus. column2: All formalisms above are equivalent in terms of computing power, ie, any computation that can be performed with a model can be performed with any of the other models. Although in theory, the models proposed are equivalent to electronic computers, provided there is no memory constraints involved. In fact, it is believed that all the theoretically possible formalization of the concept of algorithm are equivalent in power to a Turing machine; This is the Church-Turing thesis. Issues concerning the possibility to carry out certain types of computing certain types of machine (or theoretical formalism) are investigated by the theory of computability.The proposed models are equivalent to what?
column4: electronic computers, provided there is no memory constraints involved

In addition to generic computing models, some simpler computational models are useful for more stringent applications. Regular expressions are used for example to specify standards of strings, and popular applications on UNIX and in some programming languages ​​such as Perl and Python. Another mathematically equivalent to regular expressions formalism are finite automata, which are used in circuit design and in some problem-solving systems. Context-free grammars are used to specify the syntax of programming languages; an equivalent formalism are the robots to stack or pushdown automata. The primitive recursive functions form a subclass of the recursive functions.What programming languages ​​employ regular expressions?

column2: The survey is used to establish or confirm facts reaffirm the results of previous work, solve new or existing problems, theorems and support development of new theories. A research project can also be an expansion of the work spent in the field. To test the validity of instruments, procedures or experiments, the research may replicate elements from previous projects, or the project as a whole. The main objectives of basic research (as opposed to applied research) are documentation, discovery, interpretation, or research and development (R & D) methods and systems for the advancement of knowledge of the human being. Approaches to research depend on epistemologies, which vary considerably within and between the humanities and sciences. There are several ways to search: literature, descriptive, laboratory, empirical, field, academic, science, humanities, artistic, economic, social, business, marketing, research practitioner, statistics, etc.Basic research is opposed to what?

The literature covers reading, analysis and interpretation of books, periodicals, mimeographed or photocopied documents, maps, pictures, manuscripts, etc. All the collected material must be subjected to screening, from which it is possible to establish a reading plan. It is a careful and systematic reading is accompanied by notes and fichamentos that eventually may serve the theoretical basis of the study. For all this, it should be a routine both in the professional life of teachers and researchers, and in the students. This is because literature aims to understand the different scientific contributions available on a particular theme. It supports all stages of any kind of research, as it helps in defining the problem in determining the objectives, building hypotheses, in the grounds of justification for the choice of subject and preparing the final report.Where should be sent the material collected in the surveys?

column2: The type of research that is classified as "descriptive", is premised seek troubleshooting improving practices through observation, analysis and objective descriptions, through interviews with experts on the standardization of technical and content validation (THOMAS; Nelson and Silverman, 2009). The descriptive research aims to observe, record and analyze the phenomena without, however, going into the merits of its content. column2: Sometimes laboratory research is mistaken for experimental research, which is a misnomer. Although most laboratory research is experimental, often the human and social sciences throw laboratory research hand without it's experimental studies. In fact, what characterizes the laboratory research is the fact that it takes place in controlled situations, making use of specific and precise instruments. Such searches, undertake whether indoor or outdoor, in artificial environments or real, in all cases, require a proper environment previously established and according to the study to be performed. Social psychology and sociology often use laboratory research, even though fundamental aspects of human behavior can not always or, for reasons of ethics, should never be studied and / or reproduced in laboratory controlled environmentWhat laboratory research is confused?

Such searches, undertake whether indoor or outdoor, in artificial environments or real, in all cases, require a proper environment previously established and according to the study to be performed. Social psychology and sociology often use laboratory research, even though fundamental aspects of human behavior can not always or, for reasons of ethics, should never be studied and / or reproduced in laboratory controlled environmentWhat is the main feature of laboratory research?

column2: You can define Information Technology (IT) as the set of all activities and provided solutions for computing resources aimed at the production, storage, transmission, access, security and use of the information. In fact, applications for IT are many - and are linked to many areas - that there are several definitions for the term, and none of them can determine it completely. It is the area of ​​computer science that deals with the information, the organization and classification in order to enable decision making for the sake of some goal. Information technology can help to extend or reduce the private and public freedoms or become an instrument of domination.What is Information Technology?

IT is a major force in finance, transportation planning, design, production of goods, as well as in the press, in publishing activities in the music and film production, radio and television. The increasingly rapid development of new information technologies modified the libraries and documentation centers (main information storage sites), introducing new forms of organization and access to stored data and works; reduced costs and accelerated the production of newspapers and enabled the instantaneous formation of television networks worldwide. Additionally, this development facilitated and intensified the personal and institutional communication through word processing programs, training databases, desktop publishing, as well as technologies that enable the transmission of documents, sending messages and files, as well as consultations to remote computers (via global computer network such as the Internet). The diffusion of new information technologies has also brought predicaments and problems, mainly related to the privacy of individuals and their right to information, as citizens generally do not have access to lots of information about them collected by private or public institutions.In areas which IT is a major force?
column3: finance, transportation planning, design, production of goods, as well as in the press, in publishing activities in the music and film production, radio and television

column5: in finance, transportation planning, design, production of goods, as well as in the press, in publishing activities in the music and film production, radio and television

In 1960 computers started to become important for large and medium-sized enterprises, but were limitadíssimos as the applications and mutually incompatible. Advances in information technology were pulled by the hardware as improvements in cost, speed of equipment and applications, where the latter was built "from scratch" because there were no companies dedicated to the development packages. In the 1970s, the phone lines voice began to allow access to remote computer terminals and telecommunications become a technology-based, leading companies to automation of bureaucratic activities. All the action happened in the data processing room called DPCs (Data Processing Center) responsible for the processing of information, where access to this volume of data was performed by reports generated by the system or terminals connected to the central computer. In the mid 1970s technological changes began to open new options for transforming data into information and the improvement and adaptation of according to business needs systems, but was still a period of extreme centralization. The terminal for the first time, becomes flexible, allowing the computer to process different tasks simultaneously with multiple users. also comes packaged software, which combined with the flexibility of the terminals stimulated a number of innovations that have come to be known as "decision support systems". According to Keen (1996, p. XXXVII), "the greatest technical developments that time was the transition from transaction processing to the database management." Then comes the database management systems (DBMSs) that organize information in an effective manner, avoiding duplication and facilitating their analysis. Thus the old data centers began to turn into information libraries. iT professionals were the most resisted the changes.What began opening new options for transforming data into information?

In 1980, there were technological changes mainly in office technology and computers, and the term "Information Technology" has become more used. Database managers became available in PCs and low-cost software dominated the market, so attention turned to the market for new strategic basis of IT technologies. Telecommunications and computers released in the use of IT companies worldwide. It created "management awareness" programs for senior executives and the User Support Center (CSU) or the so-called Help Desk, where users consulted to answer questions, and receive advice in technology, both to allow access and knowledge of existing IT tools in business and greater acceptance.When the term "Information Technology" has become more used?

The IT professional is one that operates in one of the segments related to information technology, such as: Programming, Information Security, Networking, Databases, Systems Analysis, Software Engineering, infrastructure and hardware, among others. Each professional has a key role in organizations to systems or infrastructure that exists to continue operating properly. Additionally, the IT professional can be responsible for creating and developing new technologies. The profession is among the highest paid in the market and lack qualified professionals to fill all vacancies.Who operates in the sectors related to Information Technology?

column2: From the eighth month of pregnancy, academic pregnant may be assisted by home exercise regimen lasting three consecutive months. The academic must submit an application in the Academic Office, addressed to the Course Coordinator or equivalent, requesting the home exercise regime, attaching the medical report containing the month of pregnancy or birth date and signature, the date and the doctor's CRM. The Secretariat should formalize Academic process and submit it to the Course Coordinator or equivalent. In exceptional cases and duly supported by medical evidence, the period of the home exercise regime may be increased before and after childbirth.Pregnant women may be helped by exercise regimen from which month of pregnancy?
column4: From the eighth month of pregnancy

column2: The patients with congenital heart disease or acquired, infections, trauma or other morbid conditions which present acute or worsen dramatically disorders characterized by physical disability relative incompatible with class attendance, if verified the conservation of intellectual and emotional conditions necessary for the continuation of the activity school, will be assisted by home exercise regime. The scholar must submit application at the Academic Office, addressed to the Course Coordinator or equivalent, requesting the home exercise regime, attaching the medical report containing: the International Classification of Diseases, clearance time, the established therapy for the treatment and signature , date and medical CRM. The Secretariat should formalize Academic process and submit it to the Course Coordinator or equivalent. It will only be granted home exercise regime on absenteeism than seven consecutive days.What assist those with injuries?

column2: The request Household Exercise Regime should be protocolled immediately to the fact finding, null and void the request with retroactive value, misread the purpose of the regime. Count It will be therefore the term start of the scheme of home exercises for the application of the protocol date and the deadline for the date indicated in the medical report. Approval of application for home exercise regime is up to the Course Coordinator or equivalent, having as basis the medical report presented. When there is doubt regarding the classification of the medical report on home exercise regime, the Course Coordinator or equivalent should consult the Medical Board Official UFMS. While the Medical Board Official analyzes the medical documents submitted, the scholar shall be met by home exercise regime until it is confirmed whether or not the withdrawal. The Course Coordinator or equivalent shall immediately inform teachers the respect of scholars who are in home exercise regime.What should be protocolled the request of the home exercise regime?

The Course Coordinator or equivalent shall attach to the process of each academic who is on home exercise regimen, all documents relating to the period covered by the scheme, including copies of household and proof activities. Each teacher will define the activities to be fulfilled during the home exercise regime, as well as delivery times, being the scholar, or his attorney, responsible for picking up and dropping activities in the Course Coordination. If the academic not deliver the planned activities on the date set by the teacher, the frequency will not be recorded. It will be up to the teacher to deliver the Course Coordinator or equivalent to the academic activities returned in home exercise regime as well as the launch of the frequency in the academic system. The evaluation of the content will be in accordance with the provisions of discipline of Teaching Plan, applying the same assessment system required for other academics. The dates of the tests will be fixed by agreement between the academic, Professor and Course Coordinator or equivalent. It will be assigned zero score to academic who does not attend to perform the test.Who will define the activities to be fulfilled during the home exercise regime?

The UFMS / PROGRAD notice No. 163 of June 19, 2018, aims to the selection process of subjects that will get monitors in scholarship and voluntary classes for the second semester of 2018 in each unit of the Sector UFMS Administration. The UFMS provide this Notice via the R $ 220,800.00 (two hundred twenty thousand and eight hundred real) for the granting of 138 bags. The institutional grant is funded and monthly allowance granted by UFMS only the participant Student Program. The bag has the value of R $ 400.00 (four real) per month, the scheme being established 12 hours a week. The total number of vacancies fellows for each Sector Management Unit, was distributed proportionally based on the Total Equivalent Students Graduation (APR), ie the total number of students enrolled in Sector Management Unit.How much is the amount of notice No. 163 for selection of subjects that will get monitors?

column5: R $ 220,800.00 (two hundred twenty thousand and eight hundred reais)

column2: Computer is a machine capable of processing various types of automatic processing of information or data. A computer may have many attributes, including data storage, data processing, large-scale calculation, industrial design, handling graphics, virtual reality, entertainment and culture. In the past, the term has been applied to people responsible for some calculation. In general, it is understood by a physical computer system that performs some type of computing. There is also a strict mathematical concept, used in the theory of computation. It was assumed that personal computers and laptops are icons of the Information Age; and this is what many people consider as "computer". However, currently the most common form of computer in use are embedded systems, small devices used to control other devices such as robots, digital cameras and toys.What is computer?
column3: a machine capable of various types of automated processing of information or data processing
column4: a machine capable of various types of automated processing of information or data processing
column5: a machine capable of various types of automated processing of information or data processing

John Napier (1550-1617), Scottish inventor of logarithms, also invented Napier's bones, which were multiplication tables recorded stick, thus avoiding the memorization of multiplication tables. The first real machine was built by Wilhelm Schickard being able to add, subtract, multiply and divide. This machine was lost during the Thirty Years War, and recently found some documentation on it. For many years nothing was known about this machine, therefore, attributed to Blaise Pascal (1623-1662) the construction of the first calculating machine, which was only additions and subtractions. Pascal machine was created in order to help his father to compute taxes in Rouen, France. Pascal's design has been greatly enhanced by the German mathematician Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz (1646-1726), who also invented calculus, which dreamed that one day in the future, all reasoning could be replaced by the spin of a single lever. All of these machines, however, were far from being a general-purpose computer, for they were not programmable. This means that the entry was made only numbers, but no instructions about what to do with the numbers.Who invented logarithms?

column2: The origin of the idea to program a machine comes from the need for weaving machines to produce different color patterns. Thus, in the eighteenth century it was created a way to represent the patterns on punched paper cards that were dealt with manually. In 1801, Joseph Marie Jacquard (1752-1834) invented a mechanical loom, with an automatic card reader. The idea of ​​Jacquard crossed the English Channel, which inspired Charles Babbage (1792-1871), a math teacher from Cambridge, to develop a machine "weaving numbers," a calculating machine which could calculate how to be controlled by cards. It started with the attempt to develop a machine capable of calculating polynomials through differences, the differential calculator. While designing its differential calculator, the idea of ​​Jacquard made Babbage imagined a new and more complex machine, the analytical calculator machine with some elements that refer to the current computers.Who invented the power loom?

In 1801, Joseph Marie Jacquard (1752-1834) invented a mechanical loom, with an automatic card reader. The idea of ​​Jacquard crossed the English Channel, which inspired Charles Babbage (1792-1871), a math teacher from Cambridge, to develop a machine "weaving numbers," a calculating machine which could calculate how to be controlled by cards. It started with the attempt to develop a machine capable of calculating polynomials through differences, the differential calculator. While designing its differential calculator, the idea of ​​Jacquard made Babbage imagined a new and more complex machine, the analytical calculator machine with some elements that refer to the current computers.What is the name given to the machine that calculates polynomial through differences?

column2: The next advancement of computers was made by American Herman Hollerith (1860-1929), who devised a machine capable of processing data based on the separation of punched cards (for their holes). The Hollerith machine was used to assist in the 1890 census, reducing data processing time of seven years from the previous survey to only two and a half years. It also pioneered the use electricity in the separation, counting and tabulating cards. The company founded by Hollerith is known today as International Business Machines, or IBM.What Hollerith invented?

The first computer electromechanical was built by Konrad Zuse (1910-1995). In 1936, this German engineer built from relays who performed the calculations and read data on punched tape, the Z1. Zuse tried to sell the computer to the German government, which spurned the offer, since there would help in the war effort. The Zuse projects would be stopped during the war, giving a chance to the Americans to develop their computers. It was in World War II that really born today's computers. The US Navy, in conjunction with Harvard University, developed the computer Harvard Mark I, designed by Professor Howard Aiken, based on analytic calculator of Babbage. The Mark I occupied about 120m³, managing to multiply two ten-digit numbers in three seconds. Simultaneously, and in secret, the US Army developed a similar project, headed by engineers J. Presper Eckert and John Mauchly, whose result was the first computer to valves, the Electronic Numeric Integrator And Calculator (ENIAC), able to make five hundred multiplications per second. Having been designed to calculate ballistic trajectories, ENIAC was kept secret by the US government by the end of the war, when it was announced to the world.As Zuse built the Z1?
column3: from the calculations executed which relays data read and perforated ribbons
column5: from the calculations executed which relays data read and perforated ribbons

Even if the technology used in digital computers have changed dramatically since the first computers of the 1940s, almost all computers today still use the von Neumann architecture proposed by John von Neumann. Following the architecture, computers have four main sections, the arithmetic logic unit, control unit, memory and input and output devices. These parts are interconnected by busses. The arithmetic logic unit, control unit, registers and the basic part of input and output are known as the CPU. Some larger computers differ from the above model in one major aspect - they have multiple CPUs working simultaneously. In addition, few computers, used mainly for research and scientific computing, have significant differences from the above model, but they do not have great commercial application.When they were the first computers?

column2: The processor (or CPU) is one of the main parts of the computer hardware and is responsible for the calculations, performing tasks and data processing. The speed with which the computer performs the tasks or processes data is directly connected to the processor speed. Early CPUs were composed of many separate components but since the mid-1970s CPUs have been manufactured on a single integrated circuit, and then called microprocessors. The arithmetic logic unit (ALU) is the central processing unit, which actually performs the arithmetic and logical operations between two numbers. Its parameters include, in addition to the operands numbers, a result, a command from the control unit, and the status of the command after the operation. The set of arithmetic operations of an ALU can be limited to addition and subtraction, but could also include multiplication, division, trigonometric functions and square roots. Some can operate only with integers, while others support the use of floating point to represent real numbers (despite having limited precision).Which tasks the processor?
column3: calculations, task execution and data processing
column4: calculations, task execution and data processing
column5: calculations, task execution and data processing

column2: The control unit is the processor unit that stores the memory location containing the current instruction that the computer is running, telling the ALU what operation to perform, seeking information (memory) that the ULA need to execute it and transferring the result back to the appropriate memory location. Having done this, the control unit goes to the next instruction (typically located in the next memory location, unless the instruction is a branch instruction stating that the next instruction is in another position). The CPU also contains a restricted set of memory cells called registers that can be read and written much faster than other memory devices. They are often used to prevent continued access to main memory each time a data is required.What is stored in the control unit?
column3: the memory location containing the current instruction that the computer is running
column4: the memory location containing the current instruction that the computer is running
column5: the memory location containing the current instruction that the computer is running

The control unit is the processor unit that stores the memory location containing the current instruction that the computer is running, telling the ALU what operation to perform, seeking information (memory) that the ULA need to execute it and transferring the result back to the appropriate memory location. Having done this, the control unit goes to the next instruction (typically located in the next memory location, unless the instruction is a branch instruction stating that the next instruction is in another position). The CPU also contains a restricted set of memory cells called registers that can be read and written much faster than other memory devices. They are often used to prevent continued access to main memory each time a data is required.Which usually is the next instruction?
column5: typically located in the next memory location

column2: Memory is a device that allows the computer to store data for a time. Currently the term is generally used to define the volatile memories, such as RAM, but its primary concept also addresses non-volatile memories, such as the hard disk. computer memory part is made in the CPU; the rest is diluted components such as RAM, cache memory, hard drive and readers of removable media such as floppy, CD and DVD. In modern computers, each memory location is configured to store groups of eight bits (called a byte). Each byte can represent 256 different numbers; from 0 to 255 or -128 to +127. To store larger numbers can be used several consecutive bytes (usually two, four or eight). When negative numbers are stored, the complement notation is used for two. Computer memory is usually divided between primary and secondary, and there are researchers who claim to have memory "tertiary"What is the memory use?

column2: The input and output (I / O) devices are used for human-computer interaction. In modern personal computers, common input devices include mouse, keyboard, scanner and webcam. common output devices include a speaker, monitor and printer. What all input devices have in common is that they need to encode (convert) the information of some kind of data that can be processed by the digital computer system. output devices on the other hand, decode the data into information that is understood by the computer user. In this sense, a system of digital computers is an example of a data processing system. A process consisting of three basic steps:. Input, processing and output understand across input the information supply process, which in turn are processed (processing step) and thereafter are passed on responses to user (Output ).What are input and output devices?

To connect all these devices there is a special support plate, the motherboard, which through buses, wires and sockets connects all devices. Its role also includes the connection of auxiliary plates subcontrolam the input devices and output, such as sound card (connects to the speaker), the video card (connects to the monitor), network card (connects to the LAN) and fax-modem (connects to the telephone line). Note that the bus between the components does not constitute a connection point to point; it can logically connect several components using the same set of wires. The bus may use a serial interface or a parallel interface. Other additional equipment used in conjunction with the motherboard are the sink, a small fan to cool the processor, and the power source, responsible for the power supply of all computer components.As the motherboard devices are connected?

column2: The main feature of modern computers which distinguishes it from other machines, that can be programmed. This means that a list of instructions can be stored in memory and run later. The instructions executed in ULA discussed above are not a rich set of instructions as human language. The computer has only a limited number of well-defined instructions. A typical example of an existing instruction on most computers are "copy the contents of memory location 123 to the memory location 456", "add the contents of the memory location 510 to the content of position 511 and place the result in position 507 "and" the 012 position of the content is equal to 0, the next instruction is in position 678 ".What is the main feature of today's computers these days?
column4: The main feature of modern computers which distinguishes it from other machines, that can be programmed

column2: Instructions are represented in the computer as numbers - the code for "copy" might be 007, for example. The set of particular instructions that a computer has is known as the computer's machine language. In practice, people do not write instructions directly in machine language but in a programming language, which is then translated into machine language through special programs such as interpreters and compilers. Some programming languages ​​are very close to the machine language, such as assembly (low level language); On the other hand languages ​​like Prolog are based on abstract principles and move away enough of machine operation details (high level languages). The execution of instructions is as reading a book. Although people normally read each word and line in sequence, it is possible that sometimes she comes back to earlier points in the text of interest or pass did not interesting sessions. Likewise, a computer that follows the von Neumann architecture executes each instruction in sequential fashion, how they were stored in memory. But through special instructions, the computer can repeat instructions or advancing them until some condition is met. This is called flow control and is what allows the computer to perform tasks repeatedly without human intervention.As the instructions on the computer are represented?

Programs are simply large lists of instructions for the computer to perform such with data tables. Many computer programs contain millions of instructions, and many of those instructions are executed repeatedly. A typical personal computer (in 2003) could run about two to three billion instructions per second. Computers do not have their extraordinary capacity due to a complex set of instructions. Although there are differences in design with CPU with more instructions and more complex computers run millions of simple instructions combined, written by good "programmers". These combined instructions are written to perform common tasks such as, for example, draw a dot on the screen. These instructions can then be used by other developers.What are programs?
column4: large lists of instructions for the computer to run
column5: large lists of instructions for the computer to perform such with data tables

Nowadays, many computers appear to run multiple programs at the same time, which is commonly known as multitasking. In fact, the CPU executes instructions of a program for a short period of time and then switch to another program and executes some of its instructions. This creates the illusion of multiple programs running simultaneously through the CPU time sharing between programs. This time share is usually controlled by the operating system. In cases where the computer has two processing cores, each core processes information of a program, thus reducing the processing time.As the CPU executes instructions of a program?
column3: for a short period of time and then switch to another program and executes some of its instructions
column4: the CPU executes instructions of a program for a short period of time and then switch to another program and executes some of its instructions

column2: The trainee is a professional career start. The stage (from the Latin term Stagium by the French stage) is commonly provided by students in companies or government offices, aimed at professional improvement in their field of study. The contract is concluded between the student and the borrower, with the intervention of the educational institution, which should ensure that the contract is fulfilled faithfully. Generally, you can also characterize a period of training within companies, offered to individuals without mediation educational institutions. The stage function is to provide practical knowledge of professional functions. It enables to students, an empirical contact with the theoretical subjects that they are spent in the classroom. It is the understanding, now consolidated by educators, that theory without practice is incomplete, hampering immediate access to the labor market. The internship aims to overcome this problem.For whom is usually provided the stage?
column4: It is commonly provided by students

column2: In the Brazilian legislation, the students stage is governed by Law No. 11.788 of 25 September 2008 and does not constitute employment relationship. Although we do not have labor rights, trainees have some rights, such as the receipt of a grant (if stipulated), the fulfillment of a fixed number of hours, and the completion of statutory accident insurance plus 30 days paid recess after 1 year of internship. The ease in hiring an intern, and the complete absence of social security, the stage, for it is often used in breach of the rules established, serving as a means of informal work.What law governs the training of students in Brazilian law?
column4: the students stage is governed by Law No. 11,788

The internship contract, in Brazilian law aims at regulating a link between contractor and hired. The stage seeks complementary education in higher and technical courses. It is not considered by law a legal relationship of employment. Search up to the stage the educational training of the service provider. This contract has been criticized because it allows some employers defraud the spirit of the law, using the worker in normal activity in exchange for a grant to meet transport costs and food and not having all due social security and labor protection to the employee. So when glimpsed the actual practice of simply using less costly workforce without any educational gain for the student, will transmutation of species to the employment relationship.What is the purpose of the probationary contract?

In Brazil, a teacher is a professional who teaches classes or courses at all educational levels, namely: Early Childhood Education, Elementary school, high school and higher education, and vocational education. On October 15 is celebrated Teacher's Day. In Portugal, the teaching status is defined by the Ministry of Education, responsible for overall education policy. Across the country, there are several unions of teachers, with the largest teacher union federation of the country is the National Federation of Teachers (FENPROF). In academic career (university), the progression is Assistant Professor, Associate Professor and Professor.Who is professional who gives classes or courses at all educational levels in Brazil?

In the United States, the term teacher is reserved only to individuals who give classes in institutions of higher education (college or university). elementary and high school teachers are called Teachers. In addition to teaching itself, Professors in universities Americans are dedicated primarily to research, including the guidance of graduate students. In general, the academic degree of Doctor (Ph.D. or equivalent) is required for entry into the teaching career in American universities in the initial level of Assistant Professor (Assistant Teacher). After a few years, a Teacher Assistant can be promoted to Associate Professor (Associate professor) and subsequently the Full Teacher (Full professor, or simply Teacher). A small number of full professors who stand out for their research activities are named Distinguished Professors (or Endowed Professors), this means that now hold a personal chair (personal chair) designated by a specific name (usually the sponsor's name, individual or legal entity, which funded / funded the chair).To whom is reserved the title of professor in the United States?
column3: individuals who give classes in higher education institutions
column4: only individuals who give classes in higher education institutions
column5: only individuals who give classes in institutions of higher education (college or university)

column2: In the UK, Professor use of the title is even more restricted than in the United States, only being reserved for senior teachers in universities. The level of initial academic career in British universities, normally open to individuals who already hold a doctoral degree, is appointed Lecturer. Following are the Senior Lecturer levels, Reader and finally Professor, the latter reached only by a very small number of individuals who are often heads of academic departments or hold a personal chair. Roughly Lecturers in the British system would be equivalent to Assistant Professors in the US system, while the title of Reader would be equivalent to Associate Teacher or Teacher in the United States. Professor title itself in the UK would in turn be comparable to a Distinguished Professor or University / Institute professor in the United States. As in the United States, primary and secondary school teachers in the UK are called teachers, not teachers.How it is called the beginner in academic careers in British universities?
column4: The initial level of academic career in British universities, normally open to individuals who already hold a doctoral degree, is appointed Lecturer

The Computer Science area in UFMS had its starting point in 1987, with the implementation of the Bachelor course in Computer Science at the then Department of Mathematics UFMS. The pioneers of this deployment were Professors Edson Norberto Cáceres and Sergio Roberto de Freitas. With the implementation of the course, most teachers in the area were employed and, with the growth of the group, the Department of Computer Science and Statistics (DCT) of the Federal University of Mato Grosso do Sul (UFMS) was created in October of the year 1992 as a result of a subdivision of the then Department of Mathematics UFMS.When it implemented the Computer Science course at UFMS?

In 2009 the School of Computing (FACOM) was established with the creation of two new courses for operation in 2010: Technology Analysis and Development Systems and Technology in Computer Networks. Also in 2009, a doctorate in Computer Science UFMS, in association with UFG, was approved by Capes and starting in August / 2010. In 2011 a Facom receives the first class of the course of Bachelor of Computer Engineering and in 2015 the first class of the Bachelor Program in Software Engineering, further expanding the range of options for the community, totaling 400 students per year for graduation, and 210 in evening classes.Who approved the creation of Doctor of Science UFMS Computing?

The FACOM also has partnerships with several companies based in Campo Grande to provide services that range from training on software applications consulting in the areas of computing. The Point of Presence (POP) of the National Research Network (RNP) in Mato Grosso do Sul (MS) is administered by FACOM and headquartered in the Information Technology Center (NIN) UFMS. In addition, Redecomep, an initiative of the Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation (MCTI), coordinated by RNP, which aims to implement high-speed networks in metropolitan areas served by RNP Points of Presence, is also coordinated by Facom, under Campo Grande.Why FACOM has partnerships with several companies?
column3: to provide services that range from training on software applications consulting in the areas of Computer

column2: The activities of Computer Science Course Complementary as part of the curriculum includes relevant Afterschool program for the education of students of that course, and has 102 hours workload. This Regulation applies to all students of the Computer Science course in the second semester of 2016. The activities should be carried out throughout the course, and can be made in any of the routed semesters by the student. Among the activities that can be used for payment of hours of Complementary Activities are: Participation in scientific events (seminars, symposia, conferences, and technological conferences weeks), whether as a listener or host; monitoring education; staff members of educational projects approved by the appropriate authorities; team members extension projects approved by the appropriate authorities; staff members of research projects approved by the appropriate authorities; stages not mandatory; scientific research activities; publication of scientific papers; participation in collegiate bodies; participation in relevant courses to the area, whether as a listener or lecturer; courses taken as curriculum enrichment; participation in training and specific activities as a member of the receiving table of votes in the elections; student response to the questionnaire from the Commission for assessment of UFMS; or other activities to be evaluated by the Board Course.What activities are included in the supplementary activities?
column3: Afterschool activities relevant to the education of students of that course
column4: Afterschool activities relevant to the education of students of that course
column5: Afterschool activities relevant to the education of students of that course

column2: Participation in scientific events must be proven through the participation certificate that must obligatorily contain the name of the event, the participant's name, the location, the date it was made, the workload and the signature of the responsible for the event . The teaching monitoring must be certified through a statement issued by the unit responsible for discipline, which must obligatorily contain the display name, the name of the discipline in which he worked, the location, date (start and end) where monitoring was carried out, the workload, and the signature of the director of the supply unit of the discipline.What should the certificate of participation in scientific events?
column3: the event name, the participant's name, the location, the date it was made, the workload and the signature of the responsible for the event

The workload of each activity is the one constant in the document that proves the realization of the activity or other document where the workload is set. For specific cases of posting jobs, participation in collegiate bodies, participation in training and / or members of the receiving table of votes in the elections and the questionnaire reply student of the Commission for assessment of UFMS, we have: The workload of each published work is 68 hours. The workload of participation in collegiate bodies is computed by copying lists of attendees or the meeting minutes, with each meeting counting two hours. The workload of participation in specific training and activities such as table receiving member votes in the elections will be counted double. The workload response to student questionnaire the Commission of UFMS Self Assessment is 2 hours a questionnaire, provided that at least 75% answered the questionnaire.Which must include the hours for proving the fulfillment of the activity?
column3: document showing the completion of the activity or any other document where the workload is set
column4: document showing the completion of the activity or any other document where the workload is set
column5: document showing the completion of the activity or any other document where the workload is set

Requests for use of the activities must be made by application addressed to the Board of course, to be lodged at the Academic FACOM. Besides a brief description of the application, the applicant must attach request certified copies of documents showing the performance of activities and associated workload. use applications must be submitted thirty days before the end of the semester. Copies of the documents can be authenticated in the academic secretariat of the Faculty of Computing, since the academic bring the original and a simple copy of it at the time of use application. All vouchers of activities should be filed with the academic folder in the Academic Office, with the academic keep with the original documents and proof of delivery.It should be done the application for use of complementary activities?
column3: upon application to the Board Course
column4: upon application to the Board of course, to be lodged at the Academic FACOM
column5: upon application to the Board Course
